Ask HN: Why can’t I ‘unfollow’ a Slack message before a thread is created?
text: When someone uses an @here or @channel in a slack message and said message does not pertain to me I would like to be able to “unfollow” that message before the inevitable thread is created off of it. Why doesn’t slack allow for this? I’m assuming it’s because of the fact that messages are not threads until someone responds to a message in a thread and one can only “unfollow” (Turn off notifications for replies) threads. I’ve brought this up with other folks in my org and they’ve echoed my desire for this feature. Can any Slack employees here provide insight?

Ask HN: What'd be possible with 1000x faster CPUs?
text: Imagine if we had an unlikely scientific breakthrough and many orders of magnitude faster general-purpose CPUs, probably alongside petabyte-scale RAM modules and appropriately fast memory bus, become widely available. Besides making bloatware on a previously unimaginable scale possible, what other interesting, maybe revolutionary, impossible today or at least impractical, applications would crop up then?
